sen.j: 樺太庁（からふとちょう、、）は、日本の領有下において樺太を管轄した地方行政官庁である。
sen.e: Karafuto Agency (Karafuto-Cho) was a regional administrative agency, which controlled Karafuto under Japanese possession.
sen.cmt: Karafuto-Cho is sometimes translated as prefecture, which I think leads to a misunderstanding.
sen.e: Karafuto Agency (Karafuto-Cho) was a regional administrative agency, which controlled Karafuto under Japanese possession.
Karafuto Agency (Karafuto-Cho) was a regional administrative agency, which controlled Karafuto under Japanese possession.

sen.j: この場合、樺太とは樺太の内、ポーツマス条約により日本へと編入された50度線以南の地域（いわゆる南樺太）及びその付属島嶼を指す。
sen.e: In this case Karafuto means the region and attached islands south of the fifty northern latitude on Sakhalin (so-called Southern Sakhalin), which was incorporated into Japan through the Treaty of Portsmouth.

In this case Karafuto means the region and attached islands south of the fifty northern latitude on Sakhalin (so-called Southern Sakhalin), which was incorporated into Japan through the Treaty of Portsmouth.

In this case Karafuto means the region and attached islands south of the fifty northern latitude on Sakhalin (so-called Southern Sakhalin), which was incorporated into Japan through the Treaty of Portsmouth.

sen.j: 1907年3月15日公布の、明治40年日本の勅令の一覧第33号（樺太庁官制）に基づき、同年4月1日発足。
sen.e: Due to the Proclamation of the Imperial Ordinance Meiji (40) no.33, 1907 on March 15, 1907 Karafuto's Government's system of administration was officially established on April 1, 1907.
sen.cmt: I didn't translate 一覧as I think this is a copy and paste mistake, see ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明治時代の日本の勅令一覧
sen.e: Due to the Proclamation of the Imperial Ordinance no.33, 1907 on March 15, 1907 Karafuto's Government's system of administration was officially established on April 1, 1907.
Due to the Proclamation of the Imperial Ordinance no.33, 1907 on March 15, 1907 Karafuto's Government's system of administration was officially established on April 1, 1907.

sen.j: これにより従来の行政機関である樺太民政署は発展的解消を遂げたと言える。
sen.e: In this way the Karafuto Civil Office (Karafuto Minseisho), which was the administrative body up to then, was dissolved and absorbed into the new administration.
In this way the Karafuto Civil Office (Karafuto Minseisho), which was the administrative body up to then, was dissolved and absorbed into the new administration.
In this way the Karafuto Civil Office (Karafuto Minseisho), which was the administrative body up to then, was dissolved and absorbed into the new administration.

sen.j: 庁舎は当初大泊町に置かれていたが、1908年8月13日に豊原市へと移転した。
sen.e: The government building was first located in Otomari Town and then moved to Toyohara City on August 13, 1908.
sen.cmt: To be correct it should be Toyahara Town as it became a city only in 1937.
sen.e: The government building was first located in Otomari Town and then moved to Toyohara City on August 13, 1908.
The government building was first located in Otomari Town and then moved to Toyohara City on August 13, 1908.

sen.j: 1920年公布の、大正9年勅令第124号（樺太ニ施行スル法律ノ特例ニ関スル件）ではいわゆる外地に組み入れられたが、その後の1942年には内務省 (日本)管轄下に入り、国内法が適用されるようになった。
sen.e: According to the Proclamation in 1920, Taisho 9 Imperial Ordinance no 124 (regarding exceptions in law which is enforced on Karafuto), Karafuto-Cho became part of the so-called outer territories (gaichi), later, in 1942 it fell under the jurisdiction of the Home Ministry (Japan) and the municipal law of Japan came to be applied.
sen.cmt: Definition of Gaichi according to MOFA 「The territory governed by laws other than those of Japan proper」http://www.mofa.go.jp/mofaj/annai/honsho/sosiki/gaichi/index.html
sen.e: According to the Proclamation in 1920, Imperial Ordinance no.124, 1920 (regarding exceptions in law which is enforced on Karafuto), Karafuto-Cho became part of the so-called outer territories (gaichi), later, in 1942 it fell under the jurisdiction of the Home Ministry (Japan) and the municipal law of Japan came to be applied.
sen.cmt: Taisho 9 Imperial Ordinance no 124→Imperial Ordinance no.124, 1920としました。
sen.e: According to the Proclamation in 1920, Imperial Ordinance no.124, 1920 (regarding exceptions in law which is enforced on Karafuto), Karafuto-Cho became part of the so-called outer territories (gaichi), later, in 1942 it fell under the jurisdiction of the Home Ministry (Japan) and the municipal law of Japan came to be applied.

sen.j: これによって樺太はいわゆる内地へと編入された。
sen.e: In this way Karafuto was incorporated into the so-called Japan proper (naichi).
sen.cmt: It should be added " in 1943" see below 101,102
sen.e: In this way Karafuto was incorporated into the so-called Japan proper (naichi).
In this way Karafuto was incorporated into the so-called Japan proper (naichi).

sen.j: 1945年8月のソ連対日宣戦布告によって、樺太庁管内にはソビエト連邦軍が侵攻し、同月末までに樺太全土が占領された。
sen.e: After the Soviet Declaration of War on Japan in August 1945, Soviet troops invaded the district of Karafuto-Cho and by the end of the month all of Karafuto was occupied.
After the Soviet Declaration of War on Japan in August 1945, Soviet troops invaded the district of Karafuto-Cho and by the end of the month all of Karafuto was occupied.
After the Soviet Declaration of War on Japan in August 1945, Soviet troops invaded the district of Karafuto-Cho and by the end of the month all of Karafuto was occupied.

sen.j: 行政官庁としての樺太庁は、外務省への移管を経て、1949年6月1日、国家行政組織法の施行によって廃止されている（外務省条約局法規課『日本統治下の樺太』〈外地法制誌〉、1969年を参照）
sen.e: Karafuto-Cho as a government agency was transferred to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs jurisdiction and was then abolished in June 1, 1949 under the National Government Organization Act.

Karafuto-Cho as a government agency was transferred to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs jurisdiction and was then abolished in June 1, 1949 under the National Government Organization Act (See "Nihon Tochika no Karafuto" [Sakhalin under Japanese rule] <Gaichi Hoseishi>, Gaimusho Joyakukyoku Hokika [Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Treaty Bureau, Regulation Section]; 1969).
sen.cmt: （外務省条約局法規課『日本統治下の樺太』〈外地法制誌〉、1969年を参照）→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: Karafuto-Cho as a government agency was transferred to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs jurisdiction and was then abolished in June 1, 1949 under the National Government Organization Act (See "Nihon Tochika no Karafuto" [Sakhalin under Japanese rule] <Gaichi Hoseishi>, Gaimusho Joyakukyoku Hokika [Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Treaty Bureau, Regulation Section]; 1969).

sen.j: 当該地域の領有権及び領土問題に関する詳細は樺太の項目を参照。
sen.e: For details on territorial rights or territorial disputes of this area see Sakhalin.
For details on territorial rights or territorial disputes of this area see Sakhalin.
For details on territorial rights or territorial disputes of this area see Sakhalin.

sen.j: 南の北海道とは宗谷海峡で隔てられ、北は緯度50度線国境でソ連と接し、西の間宮海峡、東のオホーツク海に囲まれていた。
sen.e: In the South, Karafuto-Cho was separated from Hokkaido by the Soya Strait, in the North it bordered to Russia at fifty northern latitude, in the West it was surrounded by the Mamiya Strait and in the East by the Sea of Okhotsk.
sen.cmt: As the Soviet Union didn't exist at that time, ソ連 is Russia.
sen.e: In the South, Karafuto-Cho was separated from Hokkaido by the Soya Strait, in the North it bordered to Russia at fifty northern latitude, in the West it was surrounded by the Mamiya Strait and in the East by the Sea of Okhotsk.

In the South, Karafuto-Cho was separated from Hokkaido by the Soya Strait, in the North it bordered to Russia at fifty northern latitude, in the West it was surrounded by the Mamiya Strait and in the East by the Sea of Okhotsk.

sen.j: 第一次産業が基盤であり、漁業・林業・農業が主であった。
sen.e: The industry was based on primary industries, mainly fishery, forestry and farming.
The industry was based on primary industries, mainly fishery, forestry and farming.
The industry was based on primary industries, mainly fishery, forestry and farming.

sen.j: また、後には製紙業・炭鉱も盛んとなった。
sen.e: Later on paper manufacture and coal mining were booming.
Later on paper manufacture and coal mining were booming.
Later on paper manufacture and coal mining were booming.

sen.j: 人口が希少であった事から常に労働人口を欲しており、税法の優遇等により国内他地域からの移住を推進した。
sen.e: Due to the small population, workers were always in demand, migration from the mainland and other areas was promoted by tax incentives.
Due to the small population, workers were always in demand, migration from the mainland and other areas was promoted by tax incentives.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去しました。
sen.e: Due to the small population, workers were always in demand, migration from the mainland and other areas was promoted by tax incentives.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 樺太民政署の改組により、4月1日樺太庁が発足。
sen.e: Due to reorganization of the Karafuto Civil Office (Karafuto Minseisho), Karafuto-Cho was officially established on April, 1.
Due to reorganization of the Karafuto Civil Office (Karafuto Minseisho), Karafuto-Cho was officially established on April, 1.
Due to reorganization of the Karafuto Civil Office (Karafuto Minseisho), Karafuto-Cho was officially established on April, 1.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - コルサコフ（大泊）・ウラジミロフカ（豊原）・マウカ（真岡）の3支庁が設置される。
sen.e: Three branch offices were set up in Korsakov (Otomari), Vladimirofka (Toyohara) and Mauka (Maoka).
Three branch offices were set up in Korsakov (Otomari), Vladimirofka (Toyohara) and Mauka (Maoka).
Three branch offices were set up in Korsakov (Otomari), Vladimirofka (Toyohara) and Mauka (Maoka).

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 豊原支庁シスカ出張所・真岡支庁ナヤシ出張所がそれぞれ敷香支庁・名好支庁に昇格して5支庁体制となる。
sen.e: A system of five branch offices was set up as Shisuka local office of Toyohara branch office was promoted to Shikuka branch office and Nayashi local office of Maoka branch office to Nayoshi branch office respectively.

A system of five branch offices was set up as Shisuka local office of Toyohara branch office was promoted to Shikuka branch office and Nayashi local office of Maoka branch office to Nayoshi branch office respectively.

A system of five branch offices was set up as Shisuka local office of Toyohara branch office was promoted to Shikuka branch office and Nayashi local office of Maoka branch office to Nayoshi branch office respectively.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 名好支庁が久春内に移転、久春内支庁と改称。
sen.e: The Nayoshi branch office moved to Kushunnai and was called Kushunnai branch office.
The Nayoshi branch office moved to Kushunnai and was called Kushunnai branch office.
The Nayoshi branch office moved to Kushunnai and was called Kushunnai branch office.

sen.j: 10月にはさらに泊居へ移転、泊居支庁と改称。
sen.e: It then moved to Tomarioru in October and was called Tomarioru branch office.
It then moved to Tomarioru in October and was called Tomarioru branch office.
It then moved to Tomarioru in October and was called Tomarioru branch office.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 勅令第101号樺太ノ郡町村編制ニ関スル件により、17郡4町58村が設置される。
sen.e: Due to Imperial Ordinance no.101 "regarding the organization of districts, towns and villages in Karafuto", 17 districts, 4 towns and 58 villages were established.
Due to Imperial Ordinance no.101 "regarding the organization of districts, towns and villages in Karafuto," 17 districts, 4 towns and 58 villages were established.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を移動しました。
sen.e: Due to Imperial Ordinance no.101 "regarding the organization of districts, towns and villages in Karafuto," 17 districts, 4 towns and 58 villages were established.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 尼港事件により北サハリン（北樺太）も占領したが、1925年に撤兵する。
sen.e: After the Nikolayevsk Incident North Sakhalin (North Karafuto) was occupied until 1925, when the troops withdrew.
After the Nikolayevsk Incident North Sakhalin (North Karafuto) was occupied until 1925, when the troops withdrew.
After the Nikolayevsk Incident North Sakhalin (North Karafuto) was occupied until 1925, when the troops withdrew.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 樺太ニ施行スル法律ノ特例ニ関スル件により、外地に組み入れられる。
sen.e: Due to "regarding special usage of laws operation in Karafuto", Karafuto-Cho was incorporated into the outer territories (gaichi).
Due to "regarding special usage of laws operation in Karafuto," Karafuto-Cho was incorporated into the outer territories (gaichi).
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を移動しました。
sen.e: Due to "regarding special usage of laws operation in Karafuto," Karafuto-Cho was incorporated into the outer territories (gaichi).

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 支庁が再編され、豊原・大泊・留多加・元泊・敷香・本斗・真岡・泊居・鵜城の9支庁体制となる。
sen.e: The branch offices were reorganized and it became a system of 9 branch offices: Toyohara, Otomari, Rutaka, Mototomari, Shikuka, Honto, Maoka, Tomarioru and Ushiro.
The branch offices were reorganized and it became a system of nine branch offices: Toyohara, Otomari, Rutaka, Mototomari, Shikuka, Honto, Maoka, Tomarioru and Ushiro.
The branch offices were reorganized and it became a system of nine branch offices: Toyohara, Otomari, Rutaka, Mototomari, Shikuka, Honto, Maoka, Tomarioru and Ushiro.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 留多加支庁・鵜城支庁が廃止、出張所に降格して7支庁体制となる。
sen.e: It became a system of 7 branch offices, as Rutaka branch office and Ushiro branch office were abolished and demoted to local branch offices.
It became a system of seven branch offices, as Rutaka branch office and Ushiro branch office were abolished and demoted to local branch offices.
It became a system of seven branch offices, as Rutaka branch office and Ushiro branch office were abolished and demoted to local branch offices.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 拓務省が発足し、樺太庁はこれへ移管される。
sen.e: Establishment of Ministry of Colonial Affairs, Karafuto-Cho placed under its authority.
Establishment of Ministry of Colonial Affairs, Karafuto-Cho placed under its authority.
Establishment of Ministry of Colonial Affairs, Karafuto-Cho placed under its authority.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 樺太町村制が公示され、町村に自治制が敷かれる。
sen.e: -Official announcement of system of towns and villages on Karafuto, towns and villages were given the status of self-governing body.
Official announcement of system of towns and villages on Karafuto, towns and villages were given the status of self-governing body.
sen.cmt: 文頭のハイフン消去しました。
sen.e: Official announcement of system of towns and villages on Karafuto, towns and villages were given the status of self-governing body.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 樺太深海村と北海道猿払村との間に海底ケーブル及び中継所設置が完了し、電話が本州と開通する。
sen.e: Between Fukami Village in Kurafuto and Sarafutsu Village in Hokkaido the set up of an underwater cable and a relay station was completed, telephone to the main island was opened.
Between Fukami Village in Kurafuto and Sarafutsu Village in Hokkaido the set up of an underwater cable and a relay station was completed, telephone to the main island was opened.
Between Fukami Village in Kurafuto and Sarafutsu Village in Hokkaido the set up of an underwater cable and a relay station was completed, telephone to the main island was opened.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 豊原町に樺太市制が施行されて豊原市となる。
sen.e: With the enforcement of Karafuto City System Toyohara Town became Toyohara City.
With the enforcement of Karafuto City System Toyohara Town became Toyohara City.
With the enforcement of Karafuto City System Toyohara Town became Toyohara City.

sen.j: 豊原支庁は豊栄支庁と改称される。
sen.e: The Toyohara branch office was called Toyosakae branch office.
The Toyohara branch office was called Toyosakae branch office.
The Toyohara branch office was called Toyosakae branch office.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 恵須取支庁が設置されて8支庁体制となる。
sen.e: It became a system of 8 branch offices, as Esutoru branch office was established.
It became a system of eight branch offices, as Esutoru branch office was established.
It became a system of eight branch offices, as Esutoru branch office was established.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 日本放送協会豊原放送局正式に開局。
sen.e: The Japan Broadcasting Corporation officially opened Toyohara radio station.
The Japan Broadcasting Corporation officially opened Toyohara radio station.
The Japan Broadcasting Corporation officially opened Toyohara radio station.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 拓務省が他省庁とともに一元化され、大東亜省となる。
sen.e: The Ministry of Colonial Affairs and some other ministries and agencies were merged into the Ministry of Greater East Asia.
The Ministry of Colonial Affairs and some other ministries and agencies were merged into the Ministry of Greater East Asia.
The Ministry of Colonial Affairs and some other ministries and agencies were merged into the Ministry of Greater East Asia.

sen.j: これに伴い樺太庁は、内務省へ移管される。
sen.e: The authority of Karafuto-Cho was then transferred to the Home Ministry.
sen.cmt: It was decided to make Karafuto Naichi in 1942, which was enforced in 1943. 昭和17年9月1日 閣議決定 樺太ハ之ヲ内地行政ニ編入スルコト http://www.ndl.go.jp/horei_jp/kakugi/txt/txt00415.htm
sen.e: The authority of Karafuto-Cho was then transferred to the Home Ministry.
The authority of Karafuto-Cho was then transferred to the Home Ministry.

sen.j: 支庁が再編され、豊原・敷香・真岡・恵須取の4支庁体制となる。
sen.e: The branch offices were reorganized and it became a system of 4 branch offices: Toyohara, Shikuka, Maoka and Esutoru.
The branch offices were reorganized and it became a system of four branch offices: Toyohara, Shikuka, Maoka and Esutoru.
The branch offices were reorganized and it became a system of four branch offices: Toyohara, Shikuka, Maoka and Esutoru.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 樺太ニ施行スル法律ノ特例ニ関スル件が廃止され、いわゆる内地編入が行われる。
sen.e: "Regarding exceptions in law which is enforced on Karafuto" was abolished, in other words, Karafuto-Cho was incorporated into Japan proper (naichi).
"Regarding exceptions in law which is enforced on Karafuto" was abolished, in other words, Karafuto-Cho was incorporated into Japan proper (naichi).
"Regarding exceptions in law which is enforced on Karafuto" was abolished, in other words, Karafuto-Cho was incorporated into Japan proper (naichi).

sen.j: 1945年、4月以降に日本銀行が豊原市事務所を開設し、駐在員を配置。
sen.e: The Bank of Japan opened an office in Toyohara City and posted employees after April 1945.
The Bank of Japan opened an office in Toyohara City and posted employees after April 1945.
The Bank of Japan opened an office in Toyohara City and posted employees after April 1945.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - ソビエト連邦が日ソ中立条約を一方的に破棄して対日参戦。
sen.e: The Soviet Union one-sidedly broke the Soviet-Japanese Neutrality Pact and participated in the war against Japan. On August 28 it had gained control over all of the islands.
The Soviet Union one-sidedly broke the Soviet-Japanese Neutrality Pact and participated in the war against Japan.
The Soviet Union one-sidedly broke the Soviet-Japanese Neutrality Pact and participated in the war against Japan.
On August 28 it had gained control over all of the islands.
On August 28 it had gained control over all of the islands.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - ソビエト連邦占領行政下で行政執行にあたっていたが、解散を命じられ大津敏男長官を代表とする上級官吏が収監される。
sen.e: Under Soviet occupation Karafuto-Cho was made to carry out the administration, but was then ordered to dissolve and governor Toshio OTSU as a representative and other high ranked government officials were imprisoned.

Under Soviet occupation Karafuto-Cho was made to carry out the administration, but was then ordered to dissolve and governor Toshio OTSU as a representative and other high ranked government officials were imprisoned.

Under Soviet occupation Karafuto-Cho was made to carry out the administration, but was then ordered to dissolve and governor Toshio OTSU as a representative and other high ranked government officials were imprisoned.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 連合国軍最高司令官総司令部（GHQ）の指令（SCAPIN-677）により日本の施政権が停止される。
sen.e: By the memorandum of the GHQ (the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers), Japanese administrative rights over Karafuto were removed.
By the memorandum of the GHQ (the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers), Japanese administrative rights over Karafuto were removed.
By the memorandum of the GHQ (the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers), Japanese administrative rights over Karafuto were removed.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 内務省官制改正等の件（昭和21年勅令第55号）により、樺太庁は内務省から外務省へ移管される。
sen.e: Due to "Regarding revision of system of administration of the Home Ministry" (Showa (21) Imperial Ordinance no.55, 1946) Karafuto-Cho was transferred from the Home Ministry to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs jurisdiction.

Due to "Regarding revision of system of administration of the Home Ministry" (Imperial Ordinance no.55, 1946) Karafuto-Cho was transferred from the Home Ministry to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs jurisdiction.

Due to "Regarding revision of system of administration of the Home Ministry" (Imperial Ordinance no.55, 1946) Karafuto-Cho was transferred from the Home Ministry to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs jurisdiction.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正しました。

sen.j: - 国家行政組織法の施行により廃止される。
sen.e: With the enforcement of the National Government Organization Act, Karafuto-Cho was abolished.
With the enforcement of the National Government Organization Act, Karafuto-Cho was abolished.
With the enforcement of the National Government Organization Act, Karafuto-Cho was abolished.

sen.j: 樺太庁には1945年8月の時点で42の市町村（1市12町29村）、10の郡があった。
sen.e: In August 1945, there were 42 municipalities (1 city, 12 towns, 29 villages) in 10 districts in Karafuto-Cho.
In August 1945, there were 42 municipalities (1 city, 12 towns, 29 villages) and 10 counties in Karafuto-Cho.
sen.cmt: in 10 districts→and 10 countiesに修正しました。
sen.e: In August 1945, there were 42 municipalities (1 city, 12 towns, 29 villages) and 10 counties in Karafuto-Cho.

tit.j: 樺太行政区分（1929年7月1日 - 1945年8月）

sen.j: 樺太庁は4の支庁に区分されている。
sen.e: Karafuto-Cho was divided into 4 branch offices (shicho).
Karafuto-Cho was divided into four branch offices (shicho).
Karafuto-Cho was divided into four branch offices (shicho).

sen.j: 支庁は樺太庁の独立出先機関とされており、管内において本庁の事務を分掌していた。
sen.e: A branch office (shicho) was an independent branch office of Karafuto-Cho, the duties of the central government office were divided within its jurisdiction.
A branch office (shicho) was an independent branch office of Karafuto-Cho, the duties of the central government office were divided within its jurisdiction.
A branch office (shicho) was an independent branch office of Karafuto-Cho, the duties of the central government office were divided within its jurisdiction.

tit.j: 豊栄郡（とよさかえ） 豊北村
tit.cmt: District→Countyに修正、「豊北村」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。

tit.j: 大泊郡（おおとまり） 大泊町
tit.cmt: District→Countyに修正、カンマ→コロンに変更しました。

tit.j: 留多加郡（るうたか） 留多加町
tit.cmt: District→Countyに修正、スペース消去、コロン追加しました。

tit.j: 本斗郡（ほんと） 本斗町
tit.cmt: District→Countyに修正、コロン追加しました。

tit.j: 真岡郡（まおか） 真岡町

sen.j: 民政長官：熊谷喜一郎 （1905年7月28日 - 1907年3月31日）
初代：楠瀬幸彦 （1907年4月1日 - 1908年4月24日）
3代：平岡定太郎（1908年6月12日 - 1914年6月5日）
7代：昌谷彰 （1924年6月11日 - 1926年8月5日 再任）

sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去しました。
1947 doesn't make sense, as the war ended in 1945 and Toshio Otsu was arrested in December 1945 (see 112).

sen.j: 樺太刑務所真岡刑務支所
函館税関大泊税関支署
函館税関真岡税関支署
「監視署」とは、日ソ国境の北緯50度線の密貿易を監視する官署である
sen.e: "Guard Post" is a government office, which watched out for smuggling at the border to Russia at fifty northern latitude
sen.cmt: As the Soviet Union didn't exist at that time, ソ is Russia.
sen.e: "Guard Post" is a government office, which watched out for smuggling at the border to Russia at fifty northern latitude.
sen.cmt: ピリオド追加しました。
sen.e: "Guard Post" is a government office, which watched out for smuggling at the border to Russia at fifty northern latitude.

sen.j: 昭和20年までに107局が整備された。
sen.e: By 1945 one hundred and seven post offices were established.
By 1945 one hundred and seven post offices were established.
By 1945 one hundred and seven post offices were established.

sen.j: 内地編入までは樺太庁管轄下にて郵便局は設置及び監督されていた。
sen.e: Post offices were established and supervised under the jurisdiction of Karafuto-Cho, before it was incorporated into Japan proper.
Post offices were established and supervised under the jurisdiction of Karafuto-Cho, before it was incorporated into Japan proper.
Post offices were established and supervised under the jurisdiction of Karafuto-Cho, before it was incorporated into Japan proper.

sen.j: 内地編入以降は、逓信省によって監督された。
sen.e: After the incorporation into Japan proper they were supervised by the Ministry of Communications (Teishisho).
After the incorporation into Japan proper they were supervised by the Ministry of Communications (Teishinsho).
After the incorporation into Japan proper they were supervised by the Ministry of Communications (Teishinsho).

sen.j: うち普通郵便局は、大泊、豊原、真岡、泊居で他は全て特定郵便局であった。
sen.e: There were ordinary post offices (futsu yubinkyoku) in Otomari, Toyohara, Maoka and Tomarioru, all the other ones were special post offices (tokutei yubinkyoku).
sen.cmt: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/特定郵便局 http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/普通郵便局
sen.e: There were ordinary post offices (futsu yubinkyoku) in Otomari, Toyohara, Maoka and Tomarioru, all the other ones were special post offices (tokutei yubinkyoku).
There were ordinary post offices (futsu yubinkyoku) in Otomari, Toyohara, Maoka and Tomarioru, all the other ones were special post offices (tokutei yubinkyoku).

sen.cmt: 一般には小学校を卒業すると、男子は中学校、女子は高等女学校に進学します explanation should be added

sen.j: 島であるため北海道との物資・人間の輸送には、船が用いられた。
sen.e: As it is an island, ships were used to transport goods and people to and from Hokkaido.
As it is an island, ships were used to transport goods and people to and from Hokkaido.
As it is an island, ships were used to transport goods and people to and from Hokkaido.

sen.j: 島内の産業が活発化してくると、木材・石炭の速やかなる移動が急務となり、以下の鉄道線が敷かれた。
sen.e: As the industries on the island boomed, transport of lumber and coal became a pressing need. Railroad lines were laid as below.
As the industries on the island boomed, transport of lumber and coal became a pressing need. Railroad lines were laid as below.
As the industries on the island boomed, transport of lumber and coal became a pressing need and therefore railroad lines were laid as below.

sen.j: 樺太庁鉄道（1943年鉄道省に併合、その後運輸通信省の所管となる）

Karafuto-Cho Railway (merged into Ministry of Railway in 1943, later came under control of the Ministry of Communications)

sen.e: Karafuto-Cho Railway (merged into Ministry of Railway in 1943, later came under control of the Ministry of Communications)

sen.j: 仏教には、幾つかの宗派があるが最も多いのは浄土真宗で48カ寺、それに次ぐのは曹洞宗の20カ寺であった。
sen.e: In Buddhism there are many various sects, the True Pure Land Sect (Jodo Shinshu) had with 48 the most temples, followed by the Soto School (Soto-shu) with 20 temples.
In Buddhism there are many various sects, the Jodo Shinshu sect (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) had with 48 the most temples, followed by the Sotoshu sect with 20 temples.
sen.cmt: 「浄土真宗」「曹洞宗」→統一事項に基づき表記を修正しました。
sen.e: In Buddhism there are many various sects, the Jodo Shinshu sect (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) had with 48 the most temples, followed by the Sotoshu sect with 20 temples.

sen.j: 1945年、サハリン南部には宗教施設が250箇所以上（仏教寺院が150、神社が50、天理教会が50、カトリック教会が4、プロテスタント教会が5）あった。
sen.e: In the south part of Sakhalin there were more than 250 religious institutions in 1945 (Buddhist temples 150, (Shinto) Shrines 50, Tenrikyo churches 50, Catholic churches 4, Protestant churches 5).
In the south part of Sakhalin there were more than 250 religious institutions in 1945 (Buddhist temples 150, [Shinto] Shrines 50, Tenrikyo churches 50, Catholic churches 4, Protestant churches 5).
sen.cmt: カッコ表記修正しました。
sen.e: In the south part of Sakhalin there were more than 250 religious institutions in 1945 (Buddhist temples 150, [Shinto] Shrines 50, Tenrikyo churches 50, Catholic churches 4, Protestant churches 5).

sen.j: 1947年1月1日現在では153の宗教施設が州内に残っていた。
sen.e: 153 religious institutions were left in the province as of January 1, 1947.
153 religious institutions were left in the province as of January 1, 1947.
153 religious institutions were left in the province as of January 1, 1947.

sen.j: 1948年1月1日には日本の宗教施設は（仏教寺院が13、カトリック教会が2）であった。
sen.e: Japanese religious institutions (Buddhist temples 13, Catholic churches 2) as of January 1, 1948.
Japanese religious institutions were 13 Buddhist temples and 2 Catholic churches as of January 1, 1948.
sen.cmt: 一部訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Japanese religious institutions were 13 Buddhist temples and 2 Catholic churches as of January 1, 1948.
